reviewText: Very interesting DVD story of Sumo wrestling.
good documentary.. I would have like to see more matches.

This is a film about Sumo in Japan, it's tradition, it's meaning and it's beauty.  It is not a film about the Westernized version of Sumo, nor a cartoon, nor about fat people "taking up" this very respected sport.
When I was sitting in the airport in Japan I watched a television screen which covered a wall. What was playing was Japanese Sumo Wrestling.  From that moment I was in love with the beauty of the traditional version of this time honored sport.  But, in America, it is almost impossible to find films from Japan concerning Sumo.
So...  I love this film.  Every non-Japanese person who is interested in Sumo should watch it. These are not just "fat" guys!

watch it!

This dvd has great insight to the strange world of the Sumotori.
Hard to watch at times because of the training and discipline,but it is a great"put together" on the life of Takanohana. I would reccommend it to anyone interested in the world of sumo.
It is beautifly filmed, as you would expect from NKH, with some interesting detail but best seen along withGrand Sumo

I am very disappointed : Having the intention of buying this product, I found no information at all about its contents.
Miguel Zauschkevich
Santiago, Chile
